verses.roman:
yaḥ prāpya mānuṣaṁ lokaṁ
mukti-dvāram apāvṛtam
gṛheṣu khaga-vat saktas
tam ārūḍha-cyutaṁ viduḥ

synonyms: yaḥ—one who; prāpya—having achieved; mānuṣam lokam—the human form of life; mukti—of liberation; dvāram—the door; apāvṛtam—wide open; gṛheṣu—in family affairs; khaga-vat—like the bird of this story; saktaḥ—attached; tam—him; ārūḍha—having climbed high; cyutam—then falling; viduḥ—they consider.
translation: The doors of liberation are opened wide to one who has achieved human life. But if a human being simply devotes himself to family life like the foolish bird in this story, then he is to be considered as one who has climbed to a high place only to trip and fall down.
